intro: Sebaea minutiflora, commonly known as the small-flowered sebaea, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a hairy texture. Sebaea minutiflora typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and thickets.
